content.title: Laxman Award / Rani Laxmi Bai Award Scheme- Differently-abled and Posthumously
content.department: Department of Sports, Government of Uttar Pradesh
content.beneficiary: Differently-abled sportspersons and posthumously awarded sportspersons
content.details: The scheme 'Laxman Award/Rani Laxmi Bai Award' was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttar Pradesh. The sportspersons will be honoured by the state government with the Lakshman award for male sportsperson and Rani Lakshmi Bai award for a female sportsperson in 31 sports disciplines. The Laxman/Rani Laxmi Bai award will be given to differently-abled players (General Category and Veteran Category) and the Laxman Award, the highest sports award of the state will be given posthumously to Shahid.
benefits: This award recognizes sports personalities with a Citation, a Bronze statue of either Laxman or Rani Laxmi Bai, a Scroll, and a cash prize of ₹3,11,000/-.
eligibility: The player must be a bonafide native of Uttar Pradesh.

The sportspersons for at least three consecutive times for the year 2020-21 must have been a member of the state senior team for the year 2021-22 and participated in the National Games/National Senior Championship.

If a player has participated in the National Senior Championship and will participate in international competitions such as the Olympic Games, World Championship, Asian Games, etc., he/she will also be considered eligible.
The player will have to give an affidavit that he has never been a participant in the consumption of drugs in any competition/championship.
The applicant shall also submit an oath that he has not been found guilty in any suit by the Hon'ble Court nor has he been found guilty in connection with sexual harassment.
One person will be rewarded only once.
The award can also be given posthumously.
The Government may cancel the name of any person from the list of awardee sportspersons.
The players only participating in National Senior Championships/National Games will not be considered eligible for the award.
The Laxman/Rani Lakshmi Bai Award for Veteran category sportsperson age should be 40 years and above.
content.application_process: Offline. The interested applicant should take the prescribed format of the application form, fill in all mandatory fields, paste a passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all mandatory documents. Submit the duly filled and signed application form to the respective sports officer of the concerned district.
documents_required: Certificate of Sports competition/Championships of State, National & International importance
Affidavit (If not found guilty of substance abuse)
Affidavit (If not found guilty by the court in a suit/sexual harassment)

faqs.question: What is the purpose of the Laxman/Rani Lakshmi Bai Award?
faqs.answer: The purpose of the Laxman/Rani Lakshmi Bai award is to honour differently-abled, posthumously shahid players and promotes sports excellence in the state.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Sports, Government of Uttar Pradesh.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for the Award?
faqs.answer: The eligibility criteria include being a native of Uttar Pradesh, active participation in national and international competitions, and meeting age requirements.

faqs.question: Can I apply if I have only participated in National Senior Championships or National Games?
faqs.answer: No, participation in only National Senior Championships or National Games is not sufficient for eligibility.

faqs.question: Can the award be given posthumously?
faqs.answer: Yes, the award can be given posthumously.

faqs.question: What documents do I need to submit along with my application?
faqs.answer: Required documents include proof of age, identification, PAN card, domicile certificate, and sports competition certificates.
